Package application

Class Counter

java.lang.Object
application.Counter
public class Counter
extends java.lang.Object
Counter is the class used for all the word counting and sorting that happens behind the scenes of the GUI.
In this project it is used to display the 20 most used words in the poem The Raven onto a GUI.

Some important things to consider are that HTML elements and HTML class tags WILL vary from project to project.
In this case, The Raven was encapsulated within h1, h2.no-break, and div.chapter.
Element data type variables were created to reflect this project.

Version:
3.0
Author:
Gener Almestica

  • Method Details

    • getPoemWordFrequency

      public java.util.List<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer>> getPoemWordFrequency​(java.lang.String url) throws java.io.IOException
      The getPoemWordFrequency method takes the argument of a given and valid URL and creates a sorted List of the 20 most used words in the Text chosen.

      A list entry is created once the chosen HTML has been parsed so that the word frequency is displayed along side the word when displayed on the GUI.
      The GrabUrlText and GetWordFrequencyFromList methods are combined into their final result here to be displayed by the GUI.

      Parameters:
      url - an absolute URL giving the base location of chosen Text.
      Returns:
      List of Top 20 most used words in descending order.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If the link is invalid.

    • GrabUrlText

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> GrabUrlText​(java.lang.String Url) throws java.io.IOException
      Returns each occurring word in the poem The Raven individually as an array of Strings.

      This method only works for The Raven poem as the HTML tags were chosen specifically for this project.

      In order to cater to your project or web page, you must first find the Elements containing the information you need from the specified web page.
      Then create new variables using the Elements data type. The Elements data type allows you to search the document you created (in this case "doc") for specific HTML tags.
      If no elements are chosen, the entire web page is then parsed into the document. For this project, the following Elements were used:

      • h1
      • h2.no-break
      • div.chapter

      The appendages following h2 and div tags indicate the class name of that body tag.

      Once all chosen text is grabbed from the URL, we create a string variable called poem that combines chosen HTML elements.
      The poem variable is then stored to an array that converts all words to lower case, removes all non alphabetical characters, and splits by the spaces between the words.

      Parameters:
      Url - An absolute URL giving the base location of chosen Text.
      Returns:
      New array containing each word of chosen Text from start to end.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If the link is invalid.

    • GetWordFrequencyFromList

      public java.util.List<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer>> GetWordFrequencyFromList​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> stringList)
      The GetWordFrequencyMethod takes the List String called Text that was created by the GrabUrlText method and creates a descending list (most to least) of the 20 most used words in the selected HTML elements.

      A HashMap is created using the argument array stringList sent through a forEach loop, where the Key is the word and the value assigned with the key is the word frequency.
      The value/word frequency increments by +1 every time a repeated occurrence of that word happens.

      A new HashMap is created using stream so that the values in the HashMap may be ordered in descending order. Once the HashMap is sorted, a new List is created in order to store the HashMap in the desired order.

      An if/else statement is used to ensure List size is exactly 20 or less elements. If List happens to be under 20 elements then program is executed, assuming there were not enough elements, otherwise List will be capped at 20 elements.

      Parameters:
      stringList - Array containing all words from poem.
      Returns:
      Array List of Top 20 most used words from poem sorted in descending order.
